intro: Agoseris leontodon var. aspera, commonly known as the roughleaf goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, spiky fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
